body.p: HotPools are initialized, unconfigured MySQL database instances used to speed up database creation. When a user creates a MySQL database instance, if there is a HotPool instance available of the desired flavor, that instance is used and configured, instead of creating a new instance. Having an instance already initialized saves 60 to 75 percent of the time needed to create a new instance.

HotPools provide a resource vs. performance tradeoff; in order to speed instance creation, resources are allocated to keep instances running and available. HotPools should only be used if speeding up instance creation is necessary.
body.note: HotPools are only available for MySQL instances; HotPools for Vertica Preview, MongoDB, and Redis are not available.
HotPools can only be configured when the Database Service is installed; there is currently no method for modifying HotPools configuration post-installation.

section.title: Enabling and configuring HotPools
section.p: HotPools are enabled and configured using clouds.yaml. The following settings are used to configure HotPools:

ul.li: hotpools_enabled: Set to True to enable HotPools.
hotpools_max_instances: The number of instances of each flavor to maintain.
hotpools_image_name: The image used to create the HotPool instances. The only valid value is percona.
hotpools_flavor_names: A comma-delimited list of the flavors of HotPool instances to create.

section.p: Example 1: Create three instances of flavor m1.medium:
section.codeblock: clouds: mycloud: database: hotpools_enabled: True hotpools_max_instances: 3 hotpools_image_name: percona hotpools_flavor_names: 'm1.medium'
section.p: Example 2: Create two instances each of flavor m1.medium and m1.large:
section.codeblock: clouds: mycloud: database: hotpools_enabled: True hotpools_max_instances: 2 hotpools_image_name: percona hotpools_flavor_names: 'm1.medium,m1.large'

section.title: Details
section.p: When HotPools instances are created, they are assigned to one tenant. They will appear as instances named hot_pools when listed using nova list. When an instance is created, and there is a HotPools instance available of the correct flavor, the HotPools instance will be renamed hot_pools_<yourinstance> while it is being configured. A new HotPools instance will then start to spawn.
